intro: Murdannia ugemugei, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the family Commelinaceae and typically grows as an annual or perennial herb. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks. Due to its fibrous stems, it has been used traditionally for making ropes and textiles.
